ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] Does heritrix support recraw?

Current status of the AR module is =E2=80=98just getting started=E2=80=99. =


Don=E2=80=99t expect to see anything ready for serious use for at 

least=
 two to three months. Depending on the status of 

other projects it might =
even be pushed back further then 

that.

 

I don=E2=80=99t believe that c=
heckpointing will be in 1.0.0 but 

Gordon should be able to give a definit=
ive answer on 

that.

 

- Kris

 

-----Original Message-----
From: robeg=
er [mailto:reger@...] 
Sent: 4. =C3=A1g=C3=BAst 2004 22:42
To: archiv=
e-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Does heritrix supp=
ort recraw?

 

Hi Kris,

Read through your proposal and it looks good to m=
e.  Sounds like it
would provide the functionality that we want.  I know yo=
u're all busy
with the 1.0.0 release at the moment, but I was wondering wha=
t the
current status and progress is with this feature?  

On a different t=
opic, will the 1.0.0 release support checkpointing?

Rob Eger
Aptas, Inc.

=
--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Kristinn Sigurdsson" 
<kris@a...> =
wrote:
> Hi all,
> 
> I've just finished putting together a (very initial) =
proposal for an
add-on
> to Heritrix that would give it the ability to recr=
awl websites and
adjust to
> their change frequncies.
> 
> The proposal can=
 be found here http://vefsofnun.bok.hi.is/ar/. <http://vefsofnun.bok.hi.is/=
ar/> 
> 
> All feedback, questions, comments and general grumbling is welco=
me.
> 
> - Kris
> 
>

x support recraw?

> hi,Kristinn Sigurdsson=C3=AF=C2=BC=C5=92 
>  
> =C3=
=A3=E2=82=AC=E2=82=ACWhat is the purpose we use a spider?=C3=A3=E2=82=AC=E2=
=82=ACMirror a site for offline
browser,
> or monite a favorite site's upda=
te and get an alert when it changed,or 
> index some kinds of sites to buil=
d our own search engine, or add
some search
> function to a static html sit=
e...
>   all the task need the crawler have the ability to re-craw a site a=
nd
> download
> only the changed pages.I want use heritrix to build a searc=
h engine
in my
> LAN 
> and can index all the sites about agriculture,so I =
wish heritrix will do
> this for
> me. And I wish heritrix can run a job re=
peatedly in a certain
period. So I
> can add some 
> site into the seed, an=
d create a job ,then tell heritrix run this job
> everyday,
> and heritrix =
can run it automatically and update only the changed
pages of
> the sites.
=
>   thanks all the developer for develop the great spider!
>  
> ansi
>  
>=
     
>  
> Right, as Mark said this isn=C3=A2=E2=82=AC=E2=84=A2t present y=
et but is becoming a
priority so
> expect to see a lot of work done on this=
 in the coming months.
>  
> In fact I=C3=A2=E2=82=AC=E2=84=A2ll be looking=
 into doing continous repeating crawls that
adapt to
> change frequencies. =
With a little luck that will be available
sometime this
> fall. 
>  
> I wo=
uld therefor very much like to hear why you want this feature
(what do
> yo=
u hope to gain). Is it a matter of conserving disk space,
bandwidht, being
=
> polite to websites etc. Please be as verbose as you like. 
>  
> Feedback=
 on this issue from other members of the list is of course also
> welcome.
=
>  
> - Kris
>
